channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Aluminum Falls After China Reports Production Increase
item.description: Aluminum prices fell below the $2,600-a-metric-ton mark on concerns over weak winter demand and rising output in China.

item.title: Why This Frothy Market Has Me Scared
item.description: When investors are wildly optimistic, it is much harder for the market to rise and much easier for it to fall on any hint that they might be wrong.

item.title: ‘She has two financially stable children’: Does it make sense for my wealthy mother, a recent widow, to take out a $100,000 life-insurance policy?
item.description: “It was generous of our mom to offer.”

item.title: ‘I’m nervous about the market’: We’re living off my pension as practice for retirement, but I’m afraid of a market correction
item.description: My wife is younger than I am, and longevity runs in both our families.

item.title: Tech-Loving Hedge Funds Have a Crush on Utility Stocks
item.description: Old-school power companies have become darlings among hedge-fund firms thanks to their starring role in the artificial-intelligence boom.

item.title: Sterling Could Rise Further as U.K. Jobs Data Support BOE-ECB Divergence
item.description: Sterling rose after stronger-than-expected U.K. wage data boosted the yield differential against other G-10 currencies, but XTB said the currency face...

item.title: Broadcom's AI Success Won't All Come at Nvidia's Expense
item.description: There’s a new trillion-dollar AI chip maker in town, but the old one is still going to do just fine.

item.title: Nvidia stock is in a correction. Microsoft’s CEO may have just said something very worrying.
item.description: Satya Nadella, Microsoft’s CEO, and believed to be a big customer of Nvidia was talking about abundant chip supply in a recent interview.

item.title: Is business school worth it? Here are the worst reasons to get an M.B.A.
item.description: Applications to M.B.A. programs have increased sharply this year. Here’s how to tell if business school is right for you.

item.title: Roth conversions may suddenly seem like a bad idea, but here’s why retirees are still considering them
item.description: There’s more to think about than just current tax rates versus future tax rates.
